concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_LESS_THAN_10_YE: Rheumatic Heart Disease, Less than 10 Years Since Last RHD Attack
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_IF_EITHER_QUEST: Rheumatic Heart Disease, If Either Question Above is Yes
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_PATIENT_HAD_VAL:
patients with resultant CHF or valve damage should be on lifelong penicillin,
SEE BELOW for dosing regimen
concepts.CONGESTIVE_HEART_FAILURE,_SEVERITY_CLASS:
Class I - symptoms of HEART FAILURE only at activity levels that would limit normal individuals
Class II - symptoms of HEART FAILURE with ordinary exertion
Class III - symptoms of HEART FAILURE with less than ordinary exertion
Class IV - symptoms of HEART FAILURE at rest
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_PATIENT_YOUNGER: Rheumatic Heart Disease, Patient Youngert than 25 Years
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_DETAILS_ON_APPR: Patients with mechanical valves should be on Coumadin with goal INR 2.5-3.5
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_SYMPTOMS_OF_HEA: Rheumatic Heart Disease, Symptoms of Heart Failure Today
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_IF_EITHER_QUEST:
if either question above is yes,
then patient needs to be on penicillin until one of these requirements are met.
See below for dosing regimen
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_PATIENT_HAD_VAL: Rheumatic Heart Disease, Patient Had Valve Replacement
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_IS_PATIENT_GETT: Rheumatic Heart Disease, Is Patient Getting q1 Month Penicillin
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_SYMPTOMS_OF_HEA: if yes, patients with resultant CHF or valve damage should be on lifelong penicillin, SEE BELOW for dosing regimen
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_DETAILS_ON_APPR: Rheumatic Heart Disease, Details On Appropriate Anti-Coagulation
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_IS_PATIENT_GETT:
Should get PCN with doses Benzathine penicillin G
Adults above 27kg =1.2 million units IM once / 4 weeks
Children above 27kg = 600 000 units IM once/ 4 weeks
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_ON_APPROPRIATE_: Rheumatic Heart Disease, On Appropriate Anti-Coagulation
concepts.CONGESTIVE_HEART_FAILURE,_SEVERITY_CLASS: Congestive Heart Failure, Severity classification NYHA
concepts.RHEUMATIC_HEART_DISEASE,_NYHA_STAGE_11_D:
- Class I — symptoms of HEART FAILURE only at activity levels that would limit normal individuals
- Class II — symptoms of HEART FAILURE with ordinary exertion
- Class III — symptoms of HEART FAILURE with less than ordinary exertion
- Class IV — symptoms of HEART FAILURE at rest
